body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.8.0-dev+519-g6f6286e4f9

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, vim 8.2

### Operating system/version

linux 5.15.19-1-MANJARO

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.10.1

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

AUR

### How to reproduce the issue

```
nvim --clean
:for i in range(10)
au TermOpen * set ft=term
endfor
:set shell=sh
:term printf a
```
note: `10` might need to be increased if computer is better

### Expected behavior

`a` in terminal buffer.

### Actual behavior

No `a` in terminal buffer.

comment_data.body:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/f4b896198fdd44f1994397a4e5d6475a2dcec05c/src/nvim/channel.c#L789-L790
Data may be read before the channel has a terminal. More so, the channel may even be freed by the time `terminal_open` returns: 
```vim
  au TermOpen * call input('')
  term printf abc
```

title: slow autocmds cause :terminal to not output
